In three sentences
Comments
The campus is very safe and secure. Each dorm is monitored by a security camera, card access into the dorm and on-ground security patrol.
Activities include kinesiology/athletic training, music, theatre, chapel choir, band concerts, and ministry outreach. There are book clubs available.

This college is Christian based and any student who wants a well-rounded Christian education will love this school. If you are looking for a college that is interested in your success, this is the college for you.
The college offer band outings, traveling with the football team, attending plays, and singing in the chapel choir.

The food is fabulous with a 4-Star Restaurant dining. There are so many choices to choose from and the chef comes out to meet the students to get a feel for how they like the food. The food does not taste like hospital food but Mom's home cooking.
Dorm life here at ETBU is fun, safe and has a feeling of home. The students who live in the dorms are paired up for a life-long experience that is very enriching.
ETBU has over 40 programs of study and each one is geared toward not only educational but preparation for obtaining a job upon completion of college.
If you are looking for a college that is geared toward education, this college is for you.

East Texas Baptist University is a college that committed to providing resources for students education. The teachers are committed to the success of their students that attend the college. Their communication with both parent and students is the best that I have seen from any college.

There is a curfew for all students not to be roaming the campus past 12:30 a.m., and there is always campus security present at night time., 128587=New freshmen dorm being built for fall 2014. Even the old dorm we toured was nice. Definitely liked the layout with private bedrooms shared by four students with a common living area and a small kitchen. Seemed like the students enjoyed being there and lots of activities.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck Being a private Christian university, the price tag is fairly large. However, many scholarships are available. The education one receives here, in my opinion, is worth it. With professors who are passionate about Christ, students learn so much more than math and english. Students learns life skills and grow in the Lord. I believe the tuition is a small price to pay for such an education. Am enjoying being here The campus always has something going on. Whether it be small group bible lessons, corporate worship, or guest musician performing/speaking, there are multiple things one can participate in. This allows for many opportunities to meet new people, and make life-long friends. The Campus itself is beautiful: perfect for walks outside or outdoor gatherings. Overflowing with the love of Christ, the students and faculty are genuine and friendly. All of these factors combined create an enjoyable environment. Am learning a lot Teachers show a love for the subject they teach, and are available for extra help if needed. They push you to learn and give your best effort, but are there for you when you struggle. The small class sizes allow for more engaging participation. Login to rate
